name: MOCA-CMS
documentation: Moca Credit card management system specification

elements.name: 4.4 Default Interest Calculation
elements.documentation: Definition and calculation of penalty interest rates.

elements.name: 4.2 Commision Calculacion
elements.documentation: Additional charges configuration and calculation rules such as annual membership, transactions fees and penalty fees.

elements.name: 4. Credit Line
elements.documentation: It will include all revolving credit functionalities needed for the minimum viable product defined: daily interest calculation, fees, balance calculation and penalty calculations.

elements.name: 4.1 Accrual Calculation
elements.documentation: Interest rate definition, calculation and application rules.

elements.name: 4.3 Balances Calculation
elements.documentation: Definition of credit line balance components and calculation rules for each of them.

elements.name: 7. Batch
elements.documentation: Scheduled jobs or tasks that are needed in order to perform end of day process, export or import VISA files, create files for financial institutions and generate customer notifications.

elements.name: 7.3 Financial Institution Files
elements.documentation: Creation of daily settlement batches for the issuers/funding company.

elements.name: 7.4 Statement generation
elements.documentation: Creation of billing reports for banks.

elements.name: 7.5 Notifications
elements.documentation: Generation of different customer notifications to remind about due dates, minimum payments and to notify about card status changes due to payments not received.

elements.name: 7.1 VISA Files
elements.documentation: Incoming and outgoing files processing and generation of different reports for the banks.

elements.name: 7.2 End of Day process
elements.documentation: Daily process that can run manually or be programmed to run automatically at a specific time on which different activities are performed in the system: such as change business date, change card status based in different rules, delinquency and risk calculations.

elements.name: 1.1 Financial Institution
elements.documentation: It will include the general configuration of the financial institution that will issue the cards such as name, routing number, address, country, currency, VISA Business ID and other required information

elements.name: 1.2 Product
elements.documentation: Credit card product configuration, including BIN, ranges, product type, limits, fees, interest rates, allowed credit types, grace period, billing cycle definition, payment priority list, credit limits, overdraft, and renewal conditions.

elements.name: 1. Settings
elements.documentation: It will include the basic configuration needed in the system to be ready to receive a card application.

elements.name: 1.3 Customer
elements.documentation: Required information from customer to create a card application, perform KYC and check credit scoring at the credit bureau, also possibility to store required documents and have

elements.name: 3.1 VISA Switch
elements.documentation: Integration with VISA DPS switch in order to receive card based transactions performed in VISA Network.

elements.name: 3.3 Transaction Management
elements.documentation: Transaction module design that will allow to configure the behavior of different card transactions. For example, cash advances shall be registered in a different balance component and might have a different interest rate, also merchandize return transactions are credits to the card that might be treated as advance payments.

elements.name: 3.2 API
elements.documentation: Integration via API with other entities in order to receive payments (ACH) and other transactions originated in the bank. Also, it would include transactions performed between MOCA ecosystem

elements.name: 3. Transactions
elements.documentation: Integration with different actors from which it is possible to receive transactions: VISA DPS and API (from bank or Fintech) and a transaction manager to be able to configure different behavior per each transaction type.

elements.name: 10.1 From Transactions
elements.documentation: Disputes and chargebacks processing.

elements.name: 10.2 From Credit
elements.documentation: Management of complaints received from credit card interest calculations or payment applications.

elements.name: 10. Claims
elements.documentation: Dispute and chargebacks and claims from any other issues related to the credit line.

elements.name: 9. Compliance
elements.documentation: Reporting design for compliance, including regulatory reports such as Metro2, credit bureau requirements and country specific requirements.

elements.name: 9.1 Regulatory Reports
elements.documentation: Metro2 report design and generation.

elements.name: 9.3 US Compliance
elements.documentation: Other country specific required reports to report to local regulators.

elements.name: 9.2 Bureau Management
elements.documentation: Credit bureau required reports to update customer information based on credit card usage.

elements.name: 12. Accounting
elements.documentation: General ledger booking design and accounting integration with financial institutions.

elements.name: 12.1 Feeding accounting
elements.documentation: General ledger booking design and accounting integration with issuers.

elements.name: 11.2 By Transaction
elements.documentation: Configuration and calculation of rewards per card usage.

elements.name: 11. Rewards
elements.documentation: Reward program design for the credit card product.

elements.name: 11.3 By Payment
elements.documentation: Configuration and calculation of rewards when customer fulfils the payments on time.

elements.name: 11.1 Welcome
elements.documentation: Design, configuration, and calculation of welcome rewards for credit card products.

elements.name: 8.2 Internal Control
elements.documentation: Required reports to monitor the card loan portfolio such as delinquency reports, collection reports, among others.

elements.name: 8. Reports
elements.documentation: Reporting design for internal control and for banks containing VISA transactions.

elements.name: 8.1 VISA Reports
elements.documentation: Visa transactions reports generation for banks.

elements.name: 5.2 Statement
elements.documentation: Card holder account statement definition and rules for generation.

elements.name: 5.1 Cash Balance (Minimum)
elements.documentation: Minimum payment calculation definition and rules based on card product configuration.

elements.name: 5. Statements
elements.documentation: It will include the activities in the cutoff date for the card product cycle and the creation of customer monthly statements.

elements.name: 6.2 MOCA Payment - From Other Card
elements.documentation: Application of payments received via other Moca cards in the different balance components of the credit line.

elements.name: 6.1 ACH Payment
elements.documentation: Application of payments received via ACH in the different balance components of the credit line.

elements.name: 6. Payments
elements.documentation: Application of credit card payments performed either via ACH or with another MOCA card.

elements.name: 2.1 Application Capture
elements.documentation: Module design to capture all required information to create a card application and process it.

elements.name: 2.2 KYC
elements.documentation: Process to perform Know Your Customer validations.

elements.name: 2.4 Application Review
elements.documentation: Configuration of different rules to check card application and result of KYC and credit bureau validations to approve, decline, or send to manual review the card application.

elements.name: 2.3 Bureau Check
elements.documentation: Credit bureau integration in order to get the credit scoring from customer who is applying for the credit card.

elements.name: 2. Card Application
elements.documentation: It will include the different steps to capture customer information to create a card application, perform KYC, credit bureau validations and, in case application is approved, issue the card.

elements.name: 2.5 Card issuing
elements.documentation: When the card application is approved a new card will be created in the system, including the contract and account related to register the card transactions when received from payment system. Additionally, the virtual card will be issued and the process to create the physical card will be started.

elements.name: MVP MOCA CMS
elements.documentation: MOCA CMS Minimun Viable Product

elements.name: 2.3 Card Issuance
elements.documentation: When the credit card is approved the next step is to create in the system the credit card contract, accounts and card related to it. This process will include the card data generation to create the virtual card or the physical card.

elements.name: 2. Card application Processing
elements.documentation: Describes the different ways how a credit card can be requested by a customer or by an institution on behalf of the customer, the requirements to apply to a credit card, the validations that will be performed during the process and how the card will be issued and delivered once it is approved.

elements.name: 2.4 Card Delivery
elements.documentation: Delivery of batch to personalization bureau, management of card statuses and card activation from customer after the card is received.

elements.name: 2.2 Card Application Approval
elements.documentation: This is a functionality that will allow the system to decide if a credit card will be granted to a customer or if it will be declined. This decision will be made based on KYC verification, scoring received from the credit bureau, analysis of the data provided in the data capture process, and other parameters defined by the financial institution. In the case a credit card is declined the financial institution should have the possibility to review the card applications and decide if the customers can get a different card product or the same card product with different conditions.

elements.name: 2.1 Card Application Request
elements.documentation: Module designed to capture all required information to create a card application and register it in the system. The card application can be fulfilled online by a person or a batch containing multiple applications can be uploaded in the system by an operations user. Either way, there will a process to validate the data entered, register it in the system and create a card application.

elements.name: 1. Settings
elements.documentation: It will include the basic configuration needed in the system to be ready to receive a card application.

elements.name: 1.2 Product
elements.documentation: Credit card product configuration, including BIN, ranges, product type, limits, fees, interest rates, allowed credit types, grace period, billing cycle definition, payment priority list, credit limits, overdraft, and renewal conditions.

elements.name: 1.2.1 Product General Settings
elements.documentation: MOCA Credit Card will be a platform with several components such as card product management, card issuing, card authorization, card fee, charge and interest management, cardholder statement, card life cycle management, clearing and settlement, dispute, and chargeback management.

elements.name: 1.3 Customer
elements.documentation: Required information from customer to create a card application, perform KYC and check credit scoring at the credit bureau, also possibility to store required documents.

elements.name: 1.1 Financial Institution
elements.documentation: It will include the general configuration of the financial institution that will issue the cards such as name, routing number, address, country, currency, VISA Business ID and other required information

elements.name: 1.1.1 CRUD Financial Institution
elements.documentation: It includes the operations to create, modify, disable or inactivate a Financial Institution in the system.

elements.name: 1.1.1.P1 Creation
elements.documentation: The purpose of this process is to be able to create a Financial Institution in the system, this Financial Institution will be related to the issuing of a credit either as an issuer or as a sponsor

elements.name: 1.1.1.P1.2 Data Validation
elements.documentation:
Description:	
	Validation of data entered to create a Financial Institution.

Responsible:	
	System

Inputs:	
	Completed form from previous activity.

Outputs:	
	Validation result for entered data, if data is fine: go to next activity: 8.4 Data Creation, if any input is missing or in the wrong format then go to activity: 8.3 User Feedback.

Exception Outputs:	
	If Routing ID is already assigned to other institution Operations User/ Administrator should contact to the Financial Institution to verify what it is the corresponding Routing ID.

Tasks:	
1.	After the user press the button: “Create” the system performs the validations to confirm that all required fields are entered and are in the correct format.
2.	If all the fields are fine, go to next activity: 8.4 Data Creation.
3.	If there is any missing field or any of them is in a wrong format, then go to activity: 8.3 User Feedback

elements.name: 1.1.1.P1.3 User Feedback
elements.documentation:
Description:	
	Result of validation of data entered to create a Financial Institution in case any required field is missing or in the wrong format.

Responsible:	
	System

Inputs:	
	Results from previous activity: 8.2 Data Validation.

Outputs:	
	Required fields will be marked to show the user that they are mandatory and missing.
	For fields with wrong format the system will show a message indicating what is the right format for the user to correct it.

Exception Outputs:	

Tasks:	
1.	When the user presses the button “Create” a message will appear to the user indicating the following: “There are some missing or incorrect fields, please check the form and try again”.
2.	For mandatory fields not completed: the system will mark them to indicate that are missing.
3.	For fields with wrong format the system will show a message indicating what is the right format for the user to correct it.

elements.name: 1.1.1.P1.4 Data Creation
elements.documentation:
Description:	
	Creation of new record Financial Institution in the system

Responsible:	
	System

Inputs:	
	Completed and validated form.

Outputs:	
	Financial Institution created in the system in status “In Progress” and with a unique ID.

Exception Outputs:	

Tasks:	
	After the validation that the data is complete in the form, the system will create in the database a new record with the new Financial Institution and all the required relations in other tables.

elements.name: 1.1.1.P1.1 Capture
elements.documentation:
Description:	
	Complete the form with information of the Financial Institution to be added into the system.

Responsible:	
	Administrator/ Operations user

Inputs:	
1.	Financial Institution name
2.	Address
3.	Country
4.	Business Contact Name
5.	Business Contact Number
6.	Business Contact Email
7.	Technical Contact Name
8.	Technical Contact Number
9.	Technical Contact Email
10.	Currency
11.	Routing ID
12.	Payment System
13.	Payment System ID

Outputs:	
	Form completed and ready to be validated by the system.

Exception Outputs:	

Tasks:	
1.	The operations user goes to the option to add a new financial institution. A form to enter the information will be shown.
2.	The operator enters the required fields.
3.	When complete the operator press the button “create”.

elements.name: Financial Institution Contract sign
elements.documentation: Formal MOCA contract

elements.name: 1.1.5.1 Calendar
elements.documentation: the settings of the calendar to register nonbusiness dates and billing cycle configuration.

elements.name: 1.1.5 Restrictions
elements.documentation: This business service will allow MOCA to define some additional parameters to the Financial Institution related to contracts conditions, for example % of interchange fee to be charged to the FI

elements.name: 1.1.3 Operation Accounts
elements.documentation: The purpose of this business service is to define the accounts to which different transactions will be booked to a Financial Institution.

elements.name: 1.1.4 Institution Relationships
elements.documentation: This business service will allow to relate a Financial Institution to another one in case it exists a relationship such as sponsorship or cobranding to issue a credit card product.

elements.name: 1.1.6 Collections
elements.documentation: Additional parameters to define how the FI institution will handle the collection process

elements.name: 1.1.2 Product Association
elements.documentation: It will be used to relate different card products to one Financial Institution.

elements.name: 1.1.2.P4-Add Product
elements.documentation: It will allow authorized users to add credit card products to a financial institution, this operation shall start after the Financial Institution is created in the system and or when an existing Financial Institution will start offering a new card product to its customers. The card product should already be defined in the application before performing this operation

elements.name: 1.1.2.P5-Customize Product
elements.documentation: This process will allow authorized users to customize a card product for a Financial Institution. Only some parameters are allowed to be modified for the card product after this is already in use.

elements.name: 1.1.2.P6-Disable Product
elements.documentation: This operation will allow authorized users to disable card products in a Financial Institution, this means that the card product won’t be offered any more and no new cards can be generated. However, existing cards already created with this card product will continue to work until its expiration or cancellation.

elements.name: CardBatchApplicationFile
elements.documentation: Header

elements.name: 1.3 Issuer Products
elements.documentation: Product Offered by the Selected Financial Intitution

elements.name: 1. Financial Institution / Issuer
elements.documentation: Financial Institution will be related to the issuing of a credit card either as an issuer or as a sponsor

elements.documentation: MOCA CMS Operations User

elements.name: Administrator

elements.name: Junction
elements.documentation: If the financial institution state is INPROGRESS
